title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Monday 27 July 2015 - BBC News
summary: the trial of danny beaumont who is charged with the murder of a man in rushden resumes at northampton crown court .
campaigners fighting the export of the £ 15.76m sekhemka statue sold by northampton borough council call on david cameron to intervene .
people living in northampton town centre say the way the borough council runs its bin collections is n't working .
northampton town striker ivan toney remains the subject of intense transfer speculation .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on tuesday .

text: that 's all from the northamptonshire live team for today , thanks for your company .

we 'll be back tomorrow morning from 08:00 .
have a good night .

documents.title: jessie wallace and shane richie heading to northampton
text: best known for playing kat and alfie moon in eastenders , jessie wallace and shane richie are reuniting in a new adaptation of the perfect murder by crime author peter james .
the dark comedy tells the story of married couple victor and joan , and victor 's attempts at getting his wife out of his life .
the play comes to the derngate in northampton next spring .
author: Pete Cooper
Northamptonshire Live

documents.title: weather : cloudy evening and overnight
text: a mixture tonight of showers , variable cloud and clear spells and still quite windy which will help
a few showers lingering first thing tomorrow , but they should quickly clear eastwards to leave a mainly dry but breezy day .
still quite amounts of cloud but there will be some bright or sunny spells coming through .
highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: northants bowler takes 10-wicket haul
text: an amateur bowler hoping to break into first-class cricket took all 10 wickets to fall in an innings
joe dawborn returned figures of 10-22 while playing for peterborough town in the northants premier league against brixworth .
the 21-year-old also represents northants ' second team on a non-contract basis and has had trials with both middlesex and leicestershire .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new police chief wants to be 'visible and accessible '
text: i 've been with northamptonshire 's new chief constable as he started work today .
simon edens was
today he 's been out and about across the county visiting officers and staff , he told me : `` i want to be visible and accessible .
i want to be alongside my colleagues finding out what makes their job easier and trying to delivering that for them .
`` policing is about keeping people safe and what i want to do is help officers , staff and volunteers to deliver that purpose . ''
we 'll have more in tonight 's bbc look east at 18:30 on bbc one ( east ) .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: rushden murder trial : neighbour heard 'horrible shouting '
text: the neighbour of a man stabbed to death in his rushden home has told northampton crown court how she heard his `` horrible '' shouts for help .
steven smith , 23 , was stabbed to death at his home on trafford road last october .
the court heard harrowing evidence from helen garlik who said that she was in bed and woken by the sound of a male shouting and scuffling at around 0130 .
she said she heard mr smith shout for his girlfriend , `` as if he was in pain , it was horrible shouting . ''
danny beaumont , 27 , the man he had been drinking with , denies mr smith 's murder .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

northants police believe this was a result of `` accidental ignition '' .
kier has organised replacement vehicles to collect residents ' refuse , recycling and food waste , and the council says it 's ``

documents.title: victim in murder trial on alcohol and drugs
text: i 'm at northampton crown court for the trial of danny beaumont , 27 , who charged with the murder of 23-year-old steven smith at his home in rushden last october .
mr beaumont denies the charge .
the toxicology report on the victim showed mr smith was three times the drink drive limit and that he had taken cocaine in the hours before his death .
the defence barrister said : `` this is a then of a man who had a substantial quantity of alcohol together with cocaine . ''
the trial continues .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: rubbish problems down to 'information and education '
text: those without wheelie bins in northampton have told me that the strict rules over rubbish collection are
graham croucher , from st james residents association ,
residents are limited to two green-coloured sacks of waste for landfill and the rest for recycling .
in recent weeks the contractor enterprise has been refusing to collect rubbish which breaks the rules .

documents.title: carol klein : northampton professor joins plant odysseys
text: jeff ollerton , a professor of biodiversity from the university of northampton , will appear in a
the programme , plant odysseys , is presented by carol klein and tonight 's episode is all about the rose .
prof ollerton told bbc radio northampton : `` there are so many cultural associations and historical association with the roses and of course northamptonshire is the 'rose of the shires ' . ''
author: Pete Cooper
Northamptonshire Live

documents.title: rushden murder trail continues
text: the trial of a man charged with the murder of 23-year-old steven smith at his home in rushden last october has resumed at northampton crown court .
danny beaumont , 27 , denies murdering mr smith who was stabbed twice - once in the chest and again in the back while his partner and three children were in the house .
the prosecution says that mr beaumont had a row with his friend and went on to stab him .
mr beaumont denies murder , claiming that mr smith `` came at him '' and effectively pushed himself onto the knife .
the court is now hearing about the crime scene .
author: Elinor Cross
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: sekhemka export : pm david cameron urged to 'intervene '
text: campaigners fighting the export of a £ 15.76m statue sold by northampton borough council have called on david cameron to prevent it leaving britain .
the statue of sekhemka was sold to an anonymous buyer in july 2014 , but a temporary export ban later imposed .
this will expire on 29 july and british and egyptian campaigners
author: BBC News
UK

documents.title: plans for second screen at cinema
text: the royal & derngate has submitted a planning application to build a second screen at the
the proposed second screen is being designed by the same architects and interior designers responsible for the existing cinema .
the new building will be of a similar look and style , with 88 seats of the same design as the original .
the project is expected to cost around £ 650,000 .
should planning application be approved , work is expected to start later this year , with the new screen opening in time for summer 2016 .
author: Pete Cooper
Northamptonshire Live
